processing_notes: WHO states: '314 cases including 6 deaths, with a case-fatality rate of 1.9% have been reported between 14 July and 16 September 2001 in the district of Ourgaye' - interpreted as sCh cases with confirmed outbreak

source: Epidémie de choléra au Burkina Faso en 2005 PMC
processing_notes: Source states: '1050 cas de diarrhées cholériformes ont été notifiés' with 'Vibrio cholerae identifié à l'examen bactériologique des selles de 121 patients (17,2%)' - interpreted as 1050 sCh and 121 cCh
Source states: 'In 1971: 1,760 cases with 501 deaths, representing a case fatality rate of 28.5%' - interpreted as sCh cases with confirmed historical data
Source states: 'In 1973: 1,114 cases were reported, with 241 deaths and a case fatality rate of 21.6%' - interpreted as sCh cases with historical validation
Source states: 'In 1974: 632 cases with 66 deaths and a case fatality rate of 10.4%' - interpreted as sCh cases from historical surveillance
Source states: 'Entre 2005 et 2017, la surveillance épidémiologique a enregistré 1 212 cas et 25 décès (taux de létalité ≈ 2 %)' - interpreted as aggregate surveillance data
Source states: 'Three cases of cholera were notified in the Est region in 2021, all imported from Niger' with '0% case-fatality rate' - interpreted as imported sCh cases with successful containment
Source states: 'The majority of cases (82%) are reported in the Centre region containing the capital Ouagadougou' - interpreted as 82% of 1,050 total cases = 861 sCh cases in Centre region
Source states: 'In 2012, cholera deaths for Burkina Faso was 7' - interpreted as 7 deaths but case numbers not provided, unusual CFR indicates data limitation

Source states: '45% of urban cases were concentrated in sector 17 (Pissy quarter)' with 'among urban dwellers, 97% resided in Ouagadougou' - calculated as 45% of Ouagadougou cases = 380 sCh cases in Pissy district

source: Post-2005 absence period French academic validation PMC
processing_notes: Source states: 'Depuis lors, aucun cas de choléra n'a été notifié par les services de santé du pays' (Since then, no cases of cholera have been reported by the country's health services) - validated absence via academic documentation and WHO surveillance data showing zero cases 2006/2008

Validated absence period with functioning IDSR surveillance system, no reported cases between 2012 deaths and 2021 imported cases - confirmed by multiple surveillance sources stating 'absence since 2011' in eastern regions
